text: We have some internalsy improvements slated that will further decouple the Julia Base/stdlib from itself, with the eventual goal of making it a lot easier to cross the divide from a “normal” package to a fully-precompiled stdlib.  I don’t think the actual user-facing improvements will be ready for v1.7, but the changes to Packages, the build system, the stdlib layout, etc… will get us a lot closer to things like precompiling an environment and having instantaneous package loads.

text: Julian’s PR is actually a little more exciting IMO!  That’s trying to move forward on an approach similar to `GPUCompiler.jl` which may be able to compile subsets of Julia to machine code that can run without the Julia compiler.  This would allow generation of `.so` files that you can link to other programs and such; very cool stuff, but a little different from the rest of the Julia ecosystem, and of course, some things just won’t be possible in that kind of a paradigm, like `eval()`, but that’s fine for probably 90% of all Julia code.  :slightly_smiling_face:
